Details: Calabasas banned plastic bags and charges for paper bags.
Dana Point's ban went into place April 1, 2013 but does not place a charge on paper bags.
Glendale's ban will go into place on July 1, 2013 for large stores and January 1, 2014 at smaller stores.
Laguna Beach has no 10-cent surcharge on paper bags, unlike other area bans.
Long Beach banned plastic bags and charges for paper bags.
City Council approved a ban last year and is expected to vote on a final ban on June 17.
Malibu became one of the first areas in California to adopt the ban. They have banned all bags at retail and food establishments since May 27, 2009.
Manhattan Beach's ban was adopted July 15, 2008 and took effect Jan. 14, 2012.
Ojai's ban was approved Apr 11, 2012 and took effect July 1, 2012
Pasadena banned plastic bags and charges for paper bags.
Santa Monica banned plastic bags and charges for paper bags.
The county's ban was approved Nov. 11, 2010 by the Board of Supervisors and took effect in all stores by Jan. 2012 in unincorporated areas.
West Hollywood banned plastic bags and charges for paper bags.
Carpinteria's ordinance bans plastic bags and also paper bags - the first double bag ban in California.
Culver City approved a ban and it will go into effect at the end of 2013.
The entire county of San Luis Obispo, including unincorporated areas, adopted a ban with a 10-cent minimum charge on paper bags.
